block.p: Julie Maxwell Glen, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Dulaney Glen of Pfafftown, N.C., was married yesterday to Charles William Truax, a son of Elizabeth M. Kramer of New York and the late Rudd H. Truax. The Rev. Robert Thompson, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Union Church in Tyringham, Mass.

Mrs. Truax, 30, is the vice president for investor relations at Focus Partners, a financial services firm in New York. She graduated from the University of North Carolina. Her father retired as an internist with Winston-Salem (N.C.) Healthcare Plan Inc.

Julie Maxwell Glen, a daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Dulaney Glen of Pfafftown, N.C., was married yesterday to Charles William Truax, a son of Elizabeth M. Kramer of New York and the late Rudd H. Truax. The Rev. Robert Thompson, an Episcopal priest, performed the ceremony at Union Church in Tyringham, Mass.

Mrs. Truax, 30, is the vice president for investor relations at Focus Partners, a financial services firm in New York. She graduated from the University of North Carolina. Her father retired as an internist with Winston-Salem (N.C.) Healthcare Plan Inc.

Mr. Truax, 34, is the director of promotions at Smart Money and Offspring magazines in New York. He graduated from Hamilton College. His mother is a psychotherapist in private practice in New York. His father was a partner in the New York law firm of Milbank, Tweed, Hadley and McCloy. The bridegroom's stepfather, George P. Kramer, is a senior counsel at Hunton & Williams, a law firm in New York.
